    23‚Üíimport { approvalsApi } from '../api/approvals'
    24‚Üíimport { equipmentApi } from '../api/equipment'
    25‚Üíimport { materialsApi } from '../api/materials'
    26‚Üíimport { useToast } from '../components/common/ToastProvider'
    27‚Üíimport type { ApprovalRequest, ApprovalStep, Equipment, Material } from '../types'
    28‚Üí
    29‚Üíexport default function ApprovalsPage() {
    30‚Üí  const { showError, showSuccess } = useToast()
    31‚Üí  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true)
    32‚Üí  const [approvals, setApprovals] = useState<ApprovalRequest[]>([])
    33‚Üí  const [equipment, setEquipment] = useState<Equipment[]>([])
    34‚Üí  const [materials, setMaterials] = useState<Material[]>([])
    35‚Üí  const [tabValue, setTabValue] = useState('pending')
    36‚Üí  const [selectedApproval, setSelectedApproval] = useState<ApprovalRequest | null>(null)
    37‚Üí  const [dialogOpen, setDialogOpen] = useState(false)
    38‚Üí  const [actionType, setActionType] = useState<'approve' | 'reject' | null>(null)
    39‚Üí  const [comment, setComment] = useState('')
    40‚Üí  const [submitting, setSubmitting] = useState(false)
    41‚Üí  const [searchQuery, setSearchQuery] = useState('')
    42‚Üí
    43‚Üí  useEffect(() => {
    44‚Üí    loadData()
    45‚Üí  }, [])
    46‚Üí
    47‚Üí  const loadData = async () => {
    48‚Üí    try {
    49‚Üí      setLoading(true)
    50‚Üí      const [approvalsData, equipmentData, materialsData] = await Promise.all([
    51‚Üí        approvalsApi.list().catch(() => []),
    52‚Üí        equipmentApi.list().catch(() => []),
    53‚Üí        materialsApi.list().catch(() => [])
    54‚Üí      ])
    55‚Üí      setApprovals(approvalsData)
    56‚Üí      setEquipment(equipmentData)
    57‚Üí      setMaterials(materialsData)
    58‚Üí    } catch {
    59‚Üí      showError('Failed to load approval data. Please try again.')
    60‚Üí    } finally {
    61‚Üí      setLoading(false)
    62‚Üí    }
    63‚Üí  }
    64‚Üí
    65‚Üí  const pendingApprovals = approvals.filter(a => a.currentStatus !== 'approved' && a.currentStatus !== 'rejected')
    66‚Üí  const approvedApprovals = approvals.filter(a => a.currentStatus === 'approved')
    67‚Üí  const rejectedApprovals = approvals.filter(a => a.currentStatus === 'rejected')
    68‚Üí
    69‚Üí  const getDisplayedApprovals = () => {
    70‚Üí    let filtered = approvals
    71‚Üí    if (tabValue === 'pending') filtered = pendingApprovals
    72‚Üí    else if (tabValue === 'approved') filtered = approvedApprovals
    73‚Üí    else if (tabValue === 'rejected') filtered = rejectedApprovals
    74‚Üí
    75‚Üí    if (searchQuery) {
    76‚Üí      filtered = filtered.filter(a => {
    77‚Üí        const entity = getEntityDetails(a)
    78‚Üí        return entity?.name.toLowerCase().includes(searchQuery.toLowerCase())
    79‚Üí      })
    80‚Üí    }
    81‚Üí    return filtered
    82‚Üí  }
    83‚Üí
    84‚Üí  const displayedApprovals = getDisplayedApprovals()
    85‚Üí
    86‚Üí  const getEntityDetails = (approval: ApprovalRequest) => {
    87‚Üí    if (approval.entityType === 'equipment') {
    88‚Üí      return equipment.find(e => e.id === approval.entityId)
    89‚Üí    }
    90‚Üí    return materials.find(m => m.id === approval.entityId)
    91‚Üí  }
    92‚Üí
    93‚Üí  const getStepStatus = (step: ApprovalStep) => {
    94‚Üí    switch (step.status) {
    95‚Üí      case 'approved': return { icon: <CheckCircleIcon sx={{ fontSize: 18 }} />, color: 'success.main', bg: 'success.light' }
    96‚Üí      case 'rejected': return { icon: <CancelIcon sx={{ fontSize: 18 }} />, color: 'error.main', bg: 'error.light' }
    97‚Üí      case 'under_review': return { icon: <PendingIcon sx={{ fontSize: 18 }} />, color: 'warning.main', bg: 'warning.light' }
    98‚Üí      default: return { icon: <PendingIcon sx={{ fontSize: 18 }} />, color: 'text.disabled', bg: 'action.hover' }
    99‚Üí    }
   100‚Üí  }
   101‚Üí
   102‚Üí  const handleAction = (approval: ApprovalRequest, action: 'approve' | 'reject') => {
   103‚Üí    setSelectedApproval(approval)
   104‚Üí    setActionType(action)
   105‚Üí    setDialogOpen(true)
   106‚Üí  }
   107‚Üí
   108‚Üí  const handleSubmitAction = async () => {
   109‚Üí    if (!selectedApproval) return
   110‚Üí    setSubmitting(true)
   111‚Üí    try {
   112‚Üí      if (actionType === 'approve') {
   113‚Üí        await approvalsApi.approve(selectedApproval.id, comment || undefined)
   114‚Üí        showSuccess('Request approved successfully!')
   115‚Üí      } else {
   116‚Üí        await approvalsApi.reject(selectedApproval.id, comment)
   117‚Üí        showSuccess('Request rejected.')
   118‚Üí      }
   119‚Üí      setDialogOpen(false)
   120‚Üí      setSelectedApproval(null)
   121‚Üí      setActionType(null)
   122‚Üí      setComment('')
   123‚Üí      loadData()
   124‚Üí    } catch {
   125‚Üí      showError(`Failed to ${actionType} request. Please try again.`)
   126‚Üí    } finally {
   127‚Üí      setSubmitting(false)
   128‚Üí    }
   129‚Üí  }
   130‚Üí

## ‚úÖ Complexity Assessment Complete

I've successfully analyzed the task and created `complexity_assessment.json`. Here's my assessment:

### **Key Findings:**

**üîÑ Workflow Type: REFACTOR** (not a new feature)
- The ApprovalsPage.tsx already exists with a card-based list view
- The design mockup (13-approval-queue.png) shows a **table-based queue view**
- This is a UI paradigm change from cards ‚Üí table

**üìä Complexity: STANDARD**
- **Estimated files:** 7 (mainly refactoring ApprovalsPage.tsx)
- **Services:** 1 (frontend only)
- **Confidence:** 0.85

### **Why STANDARD and not SIMPLE:**
1. ‚úÖ Existing DataTable component can be reused
2. ‚úÖ Existing API (approvalsApi) already implements needed endpoints
3. ‚úÖ Existing UI components (Tabs, StatusBadge, SearchField) available
4. ‚úÖ No external integrations needed
5. ‚ö†Ô∏è Must preserve existing functionality (search, filters, approve/reject)
6. ‚ö†Ô∏è Need to handle multiple action buttons per row
7. ‚ö†Ô∏è Design shows different data structure than current implementation

### **Critical Discovery:**
The design mockup shows columns like:
- **Request Type** (Equipment Rental, Material Order, Document Sign-off)
- **Project Name** (Skyline Tower, Riverfront Park)
- **Submitted By** (J. Smith, A. Chen)
- **Priority Badge** (Pending/Urgent)

But the current implementation ties approvals to equipment/material entities. This may require data mapping adjustments.

### **Recommended Phases:**
```
discovery ‚Üí requirements ‚Üí context ‚Üí spec_writing ‚Üí planning ‚Üí validation
```

**No research phase needed** (all components exist internally)
**No self-critique needed** (standard UI refactor)

### **Validation Depth:**
- **Risk Level:** MEDIUM
- **Tests Required:** Unit + Integration
- **Security Scan:** Not needed
- **Rationale:** Need to verify approve/reject workflows remain functional after UI change

The assessment file has been saved and is ready for the orchestrator to proceed with the next phase.
I'll now read all the input files to gather the context needed for writing the spec.

  - 7 files to create/modify in frontend

2. Consume existing backend approval endpoints (no backend changes needed)
3. Implement as new page component with routing
4. Desktop-first responsive design (1280px+ width target)
5. Pagination support for large datasets

1‚Üíimport { apiClient } from './client'
     2‚Üíimport type { ApprovalRequest } from '../types'
     3‚Üí
     4‚Üíinterface ApprovalAction {
     5‚Üí  action: 'approve' | 'reject' | 'revision'
     6‚Üí  comments?: string
     7‚Üí}
     8‚Üí
     9‚Üíexport const approvalsApi = {
    10‚Üí  list: async (projectId?: string): Promise<ApprovalRequest[]> => {
    11‚Üí    const url = projectId ? `/projects/${projectId}/approvals` : '/approvals'
    12‚Üí    const response = await apiClient.get(url)
    13‚Üí    return response.data
    14‚Üí  },
    15‚Üí
    16‚Üí  approve: async (id: string, comments?: string): Promise<ApprovalRequest> => {
    17‚Üí    const response = await apiClient.post(`/approvals/${id}/approve`, { comments })
    18‚Üí    return response.data
    19‚Üí  },
    20‚Üí
    21‚Üí  reject: async (id: string, comments: string): Promise<ApprovalRequest> => {
    22‚Üí    const response = await apiClient.post(`/approvals/${id}/reject`, { comments })
    23‚Üí    return response.data
    24‚Üí  },
    25‚Üí
    26‚Üí  get: async (projectId: string, id: string): Promise<ApprovalRequest> => {
    27‚Üí    const response = await apiClient.get(`/projects/${projectId}/approvals/${id}`)
    28‚Üí    return response.data
    29‚Üí  },
    30‚Üí
    31‚Üí  processStep: async (projectId: string, approvalId: string, stepId: string, data: ApprovalAction) => {
    32‚Üí    const response = await apiClient.post(
    33‚Üí      `/projects/${projectId}/approvals/${approvalId}/steps/${stepId}/action`,
    34‚Üí      data
    35‚Üí    )
    36‚Üí    return response.data
    37‚Üí  },
    38‚Üí
    39‚Üí  myPending: async (): Promise<ApprovalRequest[]> => {
    40‚Üí    const response = await apiClient.get('/my-approvals')
    41‚Üí    return response.data
    42‚Üí  },
    43‚Üí}

     5‚Üíimport ProjectsPage from './pages/ProjectsPage'
     6‚Üíimport ProjectDetailPage from './pages/ProjectDetailPage'

     8‚Üíimport MaterialsPage from './pages/MaterialsPage'
     9‚Üíimport MeetingsPage from './pages/MeetingsPage'

    16‚Üí
    17‚Üífunction ProtectedRoute() {
    18‚Üí  const token = localStorage.getItem('authToken')
    19‚Üí  if (!token) {
    20‚Üí    return <Navigate to="/login" replace />
    21‚Üí  }
    22‚Üí  return <Outlet />
    23‚Üí}
    24‚Üí
    25‚Üíexport default function App() {
    26‚Üí  return (
    27‚Üí    <Routes>
    28‚Üí        <Route path="/login" element={<LoginPage />} />
    29‚Üí
    30‚Üí        <Route element={<ProtectedRoute />}>
    31‚Üí          <Route element={<Layout />}>
    32‚Üí            <Route path="/" element={<Navigate to="/dashboard" replace />} />
    33‚Üí            <Route path="/dashboard" element={<DashboardPage />} />
    34‚Üí            <Route path="/projects" element={<ProjectsPage />} />
    35‚Üí
    36‚Üí            <Route path="/projects/:projectId" element={<ProjectDetailPage />}>
    37‚Üí              <Route path="equipment" element={<EquipmentPage />} />
    38‚Üí              <Route path="materials" element={<MaterialsPage />} />
    39‚Üí              <Route path="meetings" element={<MeetingsPage />} />
    40‚Üí              <Route path="approvals" element={<ApprovalsPage />} />
    41‚Üí              <Route path="areas" element={<AreasPage />} />
    42‚Üí              <Route path="contacts" element={<ContactsPage />} />
    43‚Üí              <Route path="inspections" element={<InspectionsPage />} />
    44‚Üí              <Route path="rfis" element={<RFIPage />} />
    45‚Üí            </Route>
    46‚Üí
    47‚Üí            <Route path="/approvals" element={<ApprovalsPage />} />
    48‚Üí            <Route path="/audit" element={<AuditLogPage />} />
    49‚Üí          </Route>
    50‚Üí        </Route>
    51‚Üí
    52‚Üí        <Route path="*" element={<Navigate to="/login" replace />} />
    53‚Üí      </Routes>
    54‚Üí  )
    55‚Üí}

1‚Üí# Specification: Build Approval Queue List View
     2‚Üí
     3‚Üí## Overview
     4‚Üí
     5‚ÜíThis feature adds a new Approval Queue List View component to the frontend that displays pending approvals in a filterable, sortable table format. Users will be able to view all approvals requiring their action, filter by various criteria, and take action directly from the list view. The component will consume the existing `/my-approvals` and `/approvals` API endpoints to fetch approval data.
     6‚Üí
     7‚Üí## Workflow Type
     8‚Üí
     9‚Üí**Type**: feature
    10‚Üí
    11‚Üí**Rationale**: This is a new user-facing component that adds functionality to display and manage approval queues. It introduces a new view with table display, filtering capabilities, and action buttons, making it a standard feature implementation workflow.
    12‚Üí
    13‚Üí## Task Scope
    14‚Üí
    15‚Üí### Services Involved
    16‚Üí- **frontend** (primary) - Create new approval queue list view component with table, filters, and actions
    17‚Üí- **backend** (integration) - Consume existing approval endpoints for data retrieval and action execution
    18‚Üí
    19‚Üí### This Task Will:
    20‚Üí- [ ] Create a new ApprovalQueueList component using Material-UI DataGrid
    21‚Üí- [ ] Implement filter controls for status, project, date range, and approval type
    22‚Üí- [ ] Add action buttons for approve/reject/view details
    23‚Üí- [ ] Integrate with existing `/my-approvals` and `/approvals` API endpoints
    24‚Üí- [ ] Add routing configuration for the new approval queue page
    25‚Üí- [ ] Implement loading and error states
    26‚Üí- [ ] Add pagination support for large datasets
    27‚Üí
    28‚Üí### Out of Scope:
    29‚Üí- Backend API modifications (existing approval endpoints will be used as-is)
    30‚Üí- Approval workflow logic changes
    31‚Üí- Email notifications for approval actions
    32‚Üí- Bulk approval operations (can be added in future iteration)
    33‚Üí- Mobile-optimized view (desktop-first approach)
    34‚Üí
    35‚Üí## Service Context
    36‚Üí
    37‚Üí### Frontend
    38‚Üí
    39‚Üí**Tech Stack:**
    40‚Üí- Language: TypeScript
    41‚Üí- Framework: React
    42‚Üí- UI Library: Material-UI (@mui/material, @mui/x-data-grid)
    43‚Üí- Styling: Emotion
    44‚Üí- Build Tool: Vite
    45‚Üí- HTTP Client: axios
    46‚Üí- Routing: react-router-dom
    47‚Üí
    48‚Üí**Key directories:**
    49‚Üí- `src/` - Source code directory
    50‚Üí- `src/components/` - Reusable components (expected location)
    51‚Üí- `src/pages/` - Page-level components (expected location)
    52‚Üí- `src/api/` - API integration layer (expected location)
    53‚Üí
    54‚Üí**Entry Point:** `src/App.tsx`
    55‚Üí
    56‚Üí**How to Run:**
    57‚Üí```bash
    58‚Üícd frontend
    59‚Üínpm run dev
    60‚Üí```
    61‚Üí
    62‚Üí**Port:** 3000
    63‚Üí
    64‚Üí**Environment Variables:**
    65‚Üí- `VITE_API_URL`: http://localhost:8000/api/v1
    66‚Üí
    67‚Üí### Backend
    68‚Üí
    69‚Üí**Tech Stack:**
    70‚Üí- Language: Python
    71‚Üí- Framework: FastAPI
    72‚Üí- ORM: SQLAlchemy
    73‚Üí- Database: PostgreSQL
    74‚Üí
    75‚Üí**Key directories:**
    76‚Üí- `app/` - Application code
    77‚Üí- `app/api/v1/` - API route handlers
    78‚Üí- `app/models/` - Database models
    79‚Üí
    80‚Üí**How to Run:**
    81‚Üí```bash
    82‚Üícd backend
    83‚Üíuvicorn app.main:app --reload --port 8000
    84‚Üí```
    85‚Üí
    86‚Üí**Port:** 8000
    87‚Üí
    88‚Üí**Relevant API Endpoints:**
    89‚Üí- `GET /approvals` - Get all approvals
    90‚Üí- `GET /projects/{project_id}/approvals` - Get project-specific approvals
    91‚Üí- `GET /projects/{project_id}/approvals/{approval_id}` - Get approval details
    92‚Üí- `POST /projects/{project_id}/approvals/{approval_id}/steps/{step_id}/action` - Take action on approval step
    93‚Üí- `GET /my-approvals` - Get approvals for current user
    94‚Üí
    95‚Üí## Files to Modify
    96‚Üí
    97‚Üí| File | Service | What to Change |
    98‚Üí|------|---------|---------------|
    99‚Üí| `frontend/src/App.tsx` | frontend | Add new route for approval queue page |
   100‚Üí| `frontend/src/pages/ApprovalQueuePage.tsx` | frontend | Create new page component (new file) |
   101‚Üí| `frontend/src/components/ApprovalQueueList.tsx` | frontend | Create table component with filters (new file) |
   102‚Üí| `frontend/src/api/approvals.ts` | frontend | Create API client for approval endpoints (new file) |
   103‚Üí| `frontend/src/types/approval.ts` | frontend | Create TypeScript types for approval data (new file) |
   104‚Üí
   105‚Üí## Files to Reference
   106‚Üí
   107‚ÜíThese files show patterns to follow:
   108‚Üí
   109‚Üí| File | Pattern to Copy |
   110‚Üí|------|----------------|
   111‚Üí| Files to be discovered | Material-UI DataGrid usage pattern |
   112‚Üí| Files to be discovered | API integration with axios pattern |
   113‚Üí| Files to be discovered | Filter component implementation |
   114‚Üí| Files to be discovered | Page routing configuration |
   115‚Üí| `backend/app/api/v1/approvals.py` | Response data structure for approvals |
   116‚Üí
   117‚Üí## Patterns to Follow
   118‚Üí
   119‚Üí### Material-UI DataGrid Pattern
   120‚Üí
   121‚ÜíThe frontend uses `@mui/x-data-grid` for table displays. Expected pattern:
   122‚Üí
   123‚Üí```typescript
   124‚Üíimport { DataGrid, GridColDef } from '@mui/x-data-grid';
   125‚Üí
   126‚Üíconst columns: GridColDef[] = [
   127‚Üí  { field: 'id', headerName: 'ID', width: 90 },
   128‚Üí  { field: 'title', headerName: 'Title', width: 200 },
   129‚Üí  { field: 'status', headerName: 'Status', width: 130 },
   130‚Üí  // ... more columns
   131‚Üí];
   132‚Üí
   133‚Üí<DataGrid
   134‚Üí  rows={data}
   135‚Üí  columns={columns}
   136‚Üí  pageSize={25}
   137‚Üí  rowsPerPageOptions={[10, 25, 50, 100]}
   138‚Üí  checkboxSelection
   139‚Üí  disableSelectionOnClick
   140‚Üí  loading={isLoading}
   141‚Üí/>
   142‚Üí```
   143‚Üí
   144‚Üí**Key Points:**
   145‚Üí- Define column configuration with GridColDef type
   146‚Üí- Use pagination props for large datasets
   147‚Üí- Handle loading states with loading prop
   148‚Üí- Use checkboxSelection for future bulk actions
   149‚Üí
   150‚Üí### API Integration Pattern
   151‚Üí
   152‚ÜíFrontend uses axios for HTTP requests:
   153‚Üí
   154‚Üí```typescript
   155‚Üíimport axios from 'axios';
   156‚Üí
   157‚Üíconst API_BASE = import.meta.env.VITE_API_URL;
   158‚Üí
   159‚Üíexport const fetchApprovals = async (filters?: ApprovalFilters) => {
   160‚Üí  const response = await axios.get(`${API_BASE}/my-approvals`, {
   161‚Üí    params: filters
   162‚Üí  });
   163‚Üí  return response.data;
   164‚Üí};
   165‚Üí```
   166‚Üí
   167‚Üí**Key Points:**
   168‚Üí- Use environment variable for API base URL
   169‚Üí- Export async functions for each endpoint
   170‚Üí- Handle query parameters for filtering
   171‚Üí- Return typed response data
   172‚Üí
   173‚Üí### React Page Component Pattern
   174‚Üí
   175‚ÜíExpected structure for page components:
   176‚Üí
   177‚Üí```typescript
   178‚Üíimport React, { useState, useEffect } from 'react';
   179‚Üíimport { Container, Typography, Box } from '@mui/material';
   180‚Üí
   181‚Üíexport const ApprovalQueuePage: React.FC = () => {
   182‚Üí  const [data, setData] = useState([]);
   183‚Üí  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true);
   184‚Üí  const [error, setError] = useState<string | null>(null);
   185‚Üí
   186‚Üí  useEffect(() => {
   187‚Üí    // Fetch data on mount
   188‚Üí  }, []);
   189‚Üí
   190‚Üí  return (
   191‚Üí    <Container maxWidth="xl">
   192‚Üí      <Typography variant="h4" component="h1" gutterBottom>
   193‚Üí        Approval Queue
   194‚Üí      </Typography>
   195‚Üí      {/* Component content */}
   196‚Üí    </Container>
   197‚Üí  );
   198‚Üí};
   199‚Üí```
   200‚Üí
   201‚Üí**Key Points:**
   202‚Üí- Use functional components with TypeScript
   203‚Üí- Manage state with useState hooks
   204‚Üí- Fetch data with useEffect
   205‚Üí- Use Material-UI Container for layout
   206‚Üí
   207‚Üí## Requirements
   208‚Üí
   209‚Üí### Functional Requirements
   210‚Üí
   211‚Üí1. **Display Approval Queue Table**
   212‚Üí   - Description: Show all pending approvals in a paginated table view
   213‚Üí   - Acceptance: Table displays approval ID, title, project, requester, status, created date, and due date columns
   214‚Üí
   215‚Üí2. **Filter Approvals**
   216‚Üí   - Description: Provide filter controls above the table for status, project, and date range
   217‚Üí   - Acceptance: Filters update table data when changed, with immediate visual feedback
   218‚Üí
   219‚Üí3. **Sort Approvals**
   220‚Üí   - Description: Allow sorting by any column (ascending/descending)
   221‚Üí   - Acceptance: Clicking column headers sorts the data
   222‚Üí
   223‚Üí4. **View Approval Details**
   224‚Üí   - Description: Navigate to detailed approval view when clicking a row
   225‚Üí   - Acceptance: Clicking a row opens approval detail page
   226‚Üí
   227‚Üí5. **Take Actions**
   228‚Üí   - Description: Provide approve/reject action buttons in the action column
   229‚Üí   - Acceptance: Action buttons trigger appropriate API calls and update UI on success
   230‚Üí
   231‚Üí6. **Show Loading States**
   232‚Üí   - Description: Display loading indicators while fetching data
   233‚Üí   - Acceptance: Skeleton or spinner shown during API calls
   234‚Üí
   235‚Üí7. **Handle Empty State**
   236‚Üí   - Description: Show helpful message when no approvals match filters
   237‚Üí   - Acceptance: "No approvals found" message with illustration displayed when table is empty
   238‚Üí
   239‚Üí### Edge Cases
   240‚Üí
   241‚Üí1. **API Error Handling** - Display error message in Snackbar/Alert component when API fails, allow retry
   242‚Üí2. **Stale Data** - Implement refresh button or auto-refresh to ensure data is current
   243‚Üí3. **Permission-Based Display** - Show only approvals the current user has permission to view/act upon
   244‚Üí4. **Long Approval Titles** - Truncate long text with ellipsis and show full text on hover
   245‚Üí5. **Concurrent Actions** - Disable action buttons after click to prevent duplicate submissions
   246‚Üí
   247‚Üí## Implementation Notes
   248‚Üí
   249‚Üí### DO
   250‚Üí- Use Material-UI DataGrid (@mui/x-data-grid) for the table component
   251‚Üí- Implement TypeScript interfaces for all approval data structures
   252‚Üí- Follow existing Material-UI theming and styling patterns
   253‚Üí- Use axios for API calls with proper error handling
   254‚Üí- Add loading skeletons during data fetch
   255‚Üí- Implement proper TypeScr

Perfect! I now have a complete understanding. Let me proceed with creating the implementation plan.

## Phase 1 Complete: Context Understanding

**Findings:**
- **Existing DataTable component**: `frontend/src/components/ui/DataTable.tsx` - Reusable table with sorting, pagination, selection
- **Existing Approvals API**: `frontend/src/api/approvals.ts` - Already has `list()`, `myPending()`, `approve()`, `reject()` methods
- **Existing Types**: `ApprovalRequest` and `ApprovalStep` types defined in `types/index.ts`
- **Design reference**: Shows a clean table with filters, search, and action buttons
- **Route exists**: `/approvals` already points to card-based view (need new route or tab)

## PHASE 2 & 3: CREATE IMPLEMENTATION PLAN

Based on the investigation, I'll create the implementation plan using the **FEATURE** workflow (frontend-only component).

entries.content:
Perfect! I have completed the planning phase for building the Approval Queue List View. Here's what was accomplished:

## üìã Planning Session Complete

### Phase 0: Deep Codebase Investigation ‚úÖ

**Key Findings:**
- **Existing DataTable component**: Reusable table with sorting, pagination, selection at `src/components/ui/DataTable.tsx`
- **Existing Approvals API**: Complete API client at `src/api/approvals.ts` with `list()`, `myPending()`, `approve()`, `reject()` methods
- **Type definitions**: `ApprovalRequest` and `ApprovalStep` types already defined in `src/types/index.ts`
- **Design reference**: Found mockup at `design-assets/dashboard/13-approval-queue.png` showing table layout with filters and action buttons
- **Routing pattern**: Routes defined in `App.tsx`, `/approvals` exists but uses card-based layout (this will be a new table-based view)

### Implementation Plan Created ‚úÖ

**Workflow Type:** Feature (frontend-only component)

**3 Phases, 7 Subtasks:**

1. **Phase 1: Component Implementation** (3 subtasks)
   - Create `ApprovalQueueList` component with DataTable integration
   - Create `ApprovalQueuePage` wrapper component
   - Add routing in `App.tsx` for `/approval-queue`

2. **Phase 2: API Integration & Polish** (3 subtasks, depends on Phase 1)
   - Implement API integration for fetching approval data
   - Implement approve/reject action handlers with API calls
   - Add loading states, error handling, and empty state

3. **Phase 3: End-to-End Verification** (1 subtask, depends on Phase 2)
   - Full user flow verification (navigate, filter, sort, actions, pagination)

### Files Created ‚úÖ

**Planning files (gitignored):**
- ‚úÖ `implementation_plan.json` - Complete subtask-based plan with verification strategy
- ‚úÖ `context.json` - Codebase patterns and existing implementations
- ‚úÖ `init.sh` - Service startup script (executable)
- ‚úÖ `build-progress.txt` - Progress tracking document

**Files to be created by coder agents:**
- `frontend/src/pages/ApprovalQueuePage.tsx` (new)
- `frontend/src/components/ApprovalQueueList.tsx` (new)

**Files to be modified:**
- `frontend/src/App.tsx` (add route)

### Verification Strategy ‚úÖ

- **Risk Level:** Low (adds new view without modifying existing functionality)
- **Test Types:** Unit, Integration, E2E
- **Security Scanning:** Not required
- **Staging Deployment:** Not required

### Parallelism Analysis ‚úÖ

- **Max parallel phases:** 1
- **Recommended workers:** 1
- **Execution:** Sequential (frontend-only feature)

---

## üöÄ Next Steps

The planning is complete. To start implementation, run:

```bash
source auto-claude/.venv/bin/activate && python auto-claude/run.py --spec 130 --parallel 1
```

Or manually start services with:
```bash
./.auto-claude/specs/130-build-approval-queue-list-view/init.sh
```

**Note:** All planning files are gitignored and will not be committed. Only the actual code changes will be committed by the coder agent.

---

## üìê Design Reference

The design mockup shows:
- **Filter tabs**: All, Equipment, Materials, Documents
- **Table columns**: Request Type, Project Name, Submitted By, Date, Priority Badge
- **Action buttons**: Approve, Reject, Review (in each row)
- **Header**: Search bar and "New Request" button

The implementation will follow existing patterns from `DataTable.tsx` and `ApprovalsPage.tsx` to maintain consistency with the codebase.
I'll fix the validation error in context.json. Let me first read the file to understand its current structure.

1‚Üí# Specification: Build Approval Queue List View
     2‚Üí
     3‚Üí## Overview
     4‚Üí
     5‚ÜíThis feature adds a new Approval Queue List View component to the frontend that displays pending approvals in a filterable, sortable table format. Users will be able to view all approvals requiring their action, filter by various criteria, and take action directly from the list view. The component will consume the existing `/my-approvals` and `/approvals` API endpoints to fetch approval data.
     6‚Üí
     7‚Üí## Workflow Type
     8‚Üí
     9‚Üí**Type**: feature
    10‚Üí
    11‚Üí**Rationale**: This is a new user-facing component that adds functionality to display and manage approval queues. It introduces a new view with table display, filtering capabilities, and action buttons, making it a standard feature implementation workflow.
    12‚Üí
    13‚Üí## Task Scope
    14‚Üí
    15‚Üí### Services Involved
    16‚Üí- **frontend** (primary) - Create new approval queue list view component with table, filters, and actions
    17‚Üí- **backend** (integration) - Consume existing approval endpoints for data retrieval and action execution
    18‚Üí
    19‚Üí### This Task Will:
    20‚Üí- [ ] Create a new ApprovalQueueList component using Material-UI DataGrid
    21‚Üí- [ ] Implement filter controls for status, project, date range, and approval type
    22‚Üí- [ ] Add action buttons for approve/reject/view details
    23‚Üí- [ ] Integrate with existing `/my-approvals` and `/approvals` API endpoints
    24‚Üí- [ ] Add routing configuration for the new approval queue page
    25‚Üí- [ ] Implement loading and error states
    26‚Üí- [ ] Add pagination support for large datasets
    27‚Üí
    28‚Üí### Out of Scope:
    29‚Üí- Backend API modifications (existing approval endpoints will be used as-is)
    30‚Üí- Approval workflow logic changes
    31‚Üí- Email notifications for approval actions
    32‚Üí- Bulk approval operations (can be added in future iteration)
    33‚Üí- Mobile-optimized view (desktop-first approach)
    34‚Üí

   117‚Üí## Patterns to Follow
   118‚Üí
   119‚Üí### Material-UI DataGrid Pattern
   120‚Üí
   121‚ÜíThe frontend uses `@mui/x-data-grid` for table displays. Expected pattern:
   122‚Üí
   123‚Üí```typescript
   124‚Üíimport { DataGrid, GridColDef } from '@mui/x-data-grid';
   125‚Üí
   126‚Üíconst columns: GridColDef[] = [
   127‚Üí  { field: 'id', headerName: 'ID', width: 90 },
   128‚Üí  { field: 'title', headerName: 'Title', width: 200 },
   129‚Üí  { field: 'status', headerName: 'Status', width: 130 },
   130‚Üí  // ... more columns
   131‚Üí];
   132‚Üí
   133‚Üí<DataGrid
   134‚Üí  rows={data}
   135‚Üí  columns={columns}
   136‚Üí  pageSize={25}
   137‚Üí  rowsPerPageOptions={[10, 25, 50, 100]}
   138‚Üí  checkboxSelection
   139‚Üí  disableSelectionOnClick
   140‚Üí  loading={isLoading}
   141‚Üí/>
   142‚Üí```
   143‚Üí
   144‚Üí**Key Points:**
   145‚Üí- Define column configuration with GridColDef type
   146‚Üí- Use pagination props for large datasets
   147‚Üí- Handle loading states with loading prop
   148‚Üí- Use checkboxSelection for future bulk actions
   149‚Üí
   150‚Üí### API Integration Pattern
   151‚Üí
   152‚ÜíFrontend uses axios for HTTP requests:
   153‚Üí
   154‚Üí```typescript
   155‚Üíimport axios from 'axios';
   156‚Üí
   157‚Üíconst API_BASE = import.meta.env.VITE_API_URL;
   158‚Üí
   159‚Üíexport const fetchApprovals = async (filters?: ApprovalFilters) => {
   160‚Üí  const response = await axios.get(`${API_BASE}/my-approvals`, {
   161‚Üí    params: filters
   162‚Üí  });
   163‚Üí  return response.data;
   164‚Üí};
   165‚Üí```
   166‚Üí
   167‚Üí**Key Points:**
   168‚Üí- Use environment variable for API base URL
   169‚Üí- Export async functions for each endpoint
   170‚Üí- Handle query parameters for filtering
   171‚Üí- Return typed response data
   172‚Üí
   173‚Üí### React Page Component Pattern
   174‚Üí
   175‚ÜíExpected structure for page components:
   176‚Üí
   177‚Üí```typescript
   178‚Üíimport React, { useState, useEffect } from 'react';
   179‚Üíimport { Container, Typography, Box } from '@mui/material';
   180‚Üí
   181‚Üíexport const ApprovalQueuePage: React.FC = () => {
   182‚Üí  const [data, setData] = useState([]);
   183‚Üí  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true);
   184‚Üí  const [error, setError] = useState<string | null>(null);
   185‚Üí
   186‚Üí  useEffect(() => {
   187‚Üí    // Fetch data on mount
   188‚Üí  }, []);
   189‚Üí
   190‚Üí  return (
   191‚Üí    <Container maxWidth="xl">
   192‚Üí      <Typography variant="h4" component="h1" gutterBottom>
   193‚Üí        Approval Queue
   194‚Üí      </Typography>
   195‚Üí      {/* Component content */}
   196‚Üí    </Container>
   197‚Üí  );
   198‚Üí};
   199‚Üí```
   200‚Üí
   201‚Üí**Key Points:**
   202‚Üí- Use functional components with TypeScript
   203‚Üí- Manage state with useState hooks
   204‚Üí- Fetch data with useEffect
   205‚Üí- Use Material-UI Container for layout
   206‚Üí
   207‚Üí## Requirements
   208‚Üí
   209‚Üí### Functional Requirements
   210‚Üí
   211‚Üí1. **Display Approval Queue Table**
   212‚Üí   - Description: Show all pending approvals in a paginated table view
   213‚Üí   - Acceptance: Table displays approval ID, title, project, requester, status, created date, and due date columns
   214‚Üí
   215‚Üí2. **Filter Approvals**
   216‚Üí   - Description: Provide filter controls above the table for status, project, and date range
   217‚Üí   - Acceptance: Filters update table data when changed, with immediate visual feedback
   218‚Üí
   219‚Üí3. **Sort Approvals**
   220‚Üí   - Description: Allow sorting by any column (ascending/descending)
   221‚Üí   - Acceptance: Clicking column headers sorts the data
   222‚Üí
   223‚Üí4. **View Approval Details**
   224‚Üí   - Description: Navigate to detailed approval view when clicking a row
   225‚Üí   - Acceptance: Clicking a row opens approval detail page
   226‚Üí
   227‚Üí5. **Take Actions**
   228‚Üí   - Description: Provide approve/reject action buttons in the action column
   229‚Üí   - Acceptance: Action buttons trigger appropriate API calls and update UI on success
   230‚Üí
   231‚Üí6. **Show Loading States**
   232‚Üí   - Description: Display loading indicators while fetching data
   233‚Üí   - Acceptance: Skeleton or spinner shown during API calls
   234‚Üí
   235‚Üí7. **Handle Empty State**
   236‚Üí   - Description: Show helpful message when no approvals match filters
   237‚Üí   - Acceptance: "No approvals found" message with illustration displayed when table is empty
   238‚Üí
   239‚Üí### Edge Cases
   240‚Üí
   241‚Üí1. **API Error Handling** - Display error message in Snackbar/Alert component when API fails, allow retry
   242‚Üí2. **Stale Data** - Implement refresh button or auto-refresh to ensure data is current
   243‚Üí3. **Permission-Based Display** - Show only approvals the current user has permission to view/act upon
   244‚Üí4. **Long Approval Titles** - Truncate long text with ellipsis and show full text on hover
   245‚Üí5. **Concurrent Actions** - Disable action buttons after click to prevent duplicate submissions
   246‚Üí
   247‚Üí## Implementation Notes
   248‚Üí
   249‚Üí### DO
   250‚Üí- Use Material-UI DataGrid (@mui/x-data-grid) for the table component
   251‚Üí- Implement TypeScript interfaces for all approval data structures
   252‚Üí- Follow existing Material-UI theming and styling patterns
   253‚Üí- Use axios for API calls with proper error handling
   254‚Üí- Add loading skeletons during data fetch
   255‚Üí- Implement proper TypeScr

    66‚Üí  const approvedApprovals = approvals.filter(a => a.currentStatus === 'approved')
    67‚Üí  const rejectedApprovals = approvals.filter(a => a.currentStatus === 'rejected')

    98‚Üí      default: return { icon: <PendingIcon sx={{ fontSize: 18 }} />, color: 'text.disabled', bg: 'action.hover' }

   100‚Üí  }

1‚Üíimport { apiClient } from './client'
     2‚Üíimport type { ApprovalRequest } from '../types'
     3‚Üí
     4‚Üíinterface ApprovalAction {

     8‚Üí
     9‚Üíexport const approvalsApi = {
    10‚Üí  list: async (projectId?: string): Promise<ApprovalRequest[]> => {
    11‚Üí    const url = projectId ? `/projects/${projectId}/approvals` : '/approvals'
    12‚Üí    const response = await apiClient.get(url)

    15‚Üí
    16‚Üí  approve: async (id: string, comments?: string): Promise<ApprovalRequest> => {
    17‚Üí    const response = await apiClient.post(`/approvals/${id}/approve`, { comments })

    20‚Üí
    21‚Üí  reject: async (id: string, comments: string): Promise<ApprovalRequest> => {
    22‚Üí    const response = await apiClient.post(`/approvals/${id}/reject`, { comments })
    23‚Üí    return response.data
    24‚Üí  },
    25‚Üí
    26‚Üí  get: async (projectId: string, id: string): Promise<ApprovalRequest> => {
    27‚Üí    const response = await apiClient.get(`/projects/${projectId}/approvals/${id}`)
    28‚Üí    return response.data
    29‚Üí  },
    30‚Üí
    31‚Üí  processStep: async (projectId: string, approvalId: string, stepId: string, data: ApprovalAction) => {
    32‚Üí    const response = await apiClient.post(
    33‚Üí      `/projects/${projectId}/approvals/${approvalId}/steps/${stepId}/action`,
    34‚Üí      data
    35‚Üí    )
    36‚Üí    return response.data

entries.detail:
1‚Üí# Specification: Build Approval Queue List View
     2‚Üí
     3‚Üí## Overview
     4‚Üí
     5‚ÜíThis feature adds a new Approval Queue List View component to the frontend that displays pending approvals in a filterable, sortable table format. Users will be able to view all approvals requiring their action, filter by various criteria, and take action directly from the list view. The component will consume the existing `/my-approvals` and `/approvals` API endpoints to fetch approval data.
     6‚Üí
     7‚Üí## Workflow Type
     8‚Üí
     9‚Üí**Type**: feature
    10‚Üí
    11‚Üí**Rationale**: This is a new user-facing component that adds functionality to display and manage approval queues. It introduces a new view with table display, filtering capabilities, and action buttons, making it a standard feature implementation workflow.
    12‚Üí
    13‚Üí## Task Scope
    14‚Üí
    15‚Üí### Services Involved
    16‚Üí- **frontend** (primary) - Create new approval queue list view component with table, filters, and actions
    17‚Üí- **backend** (integration) - Consume existing approval endpoints for data retrieval and action execution
    18‚Üí
    19‚Üí### This Task Will:
    20‚Üí- [ ] Create a new ApprovalQueueList component using Material-UI DataGrid
    21‚Üí- [ ] Implement filter controls for status, project, date range, and approval type
    22‚Üí- [ ] Add action buttons for approve/reject/view details
    23‚Üí- [ ] Integrate with existing `/my-approvals` and `/approvals` API endpoints
    24‚Üí- [ ] Add routing configuration for the new approval queue page
    25‚Üí- [ ] Implement loading and error states
    26‚Üí- [ ] Add pagination support for large datasets
    27‚Üí
    28‚Üí### Out of Scope:
    29‚Üí- Backend API modifications (existing approval endpoints will be used as-is)
    30‚Üí- Approval workflow logic changes
    31‚Üí- Email notifications for approval actions
    32‚Üí- Bulk approval operations (can be added in future iteration)
    33‚Üí- Mobile-optimized view (desktop-first approach)
    34‚Üí
    35‚Üí## Service Context
    36‚Üí
    37‚Üí### Frontend
    38‚Üí
    39‚Üí**Tech Stack:**
    40‚Üí- Language: TypeScript
    41‚Üí- Framework: React
    42‚Üí- UI Library: Material-UI (@mui/material, @mui/x-data-grid)
    43‚Üí- Styling: Emotion
    44‚Üí- Build Tool: Vite
    45‚Üí- HTTP Client: axios
    46‚Üí- Routing: react-router-dom
    47‚Üí
    48‚Üí**Key directories:**
    49‚Üí- `src/` - Source code directory
    50‚Üí- `src/components/` - Reusable components (expected location)
    51‚Üí- `src/pages/` - Page-level components (expected location)
    52‚Üí- `src/api/` - API integration layer (expected location)
    53‚Üí
    54‚Üí**Entry Point:** `src/App.tsx`
    55‚Üí
    56‚Üí**How to Run:**
    57‚Üí```bash
    58‚Üícd frontend
    59‚Üínpm run dev
    60‚Üí```
    61‚Üí
    62‚Üí**Port:** 3000
    63‚Üí
    64‚Üí**Environment Variables:**
    65‚Üí- `VITE_API_URL`: http://localhost:8000/api/v1
    66‚Üí
    67‚Üí### Backend
    68‚Üí
    69‚Üí**Tech Stack:**
    70‚Üí- Language: Python
    71‚Üí- Framework: FastAPI
    72‚Üí- ORM: SQLAlchemy
    73‚Üí- Database: PostgreSQL
    74‚Üí
    75‚Üí**Key directories:**
    76‚Üí- `app/` - Application code
    77‚Üí- `app/api/v1/` - API route handlers
    78‚Üí- `app/models/` - Database models
    79‚Üí
    80‚Üí**How to Run:**
    81‚Üí```bash
    82‚Üícd backend
    83‚Üíuvicorn app.main:app --reload --port 8000
    84‚Üí```
    85‚Üí
    86‚Üí**Port:** 8000
    87‚Üí
    88‚Üí**Relevant API Endpoints:**
    89‚Üí- `GET /approvals` - Get all approvals
    90‚Üí- `GET /projects/{project_id}/approvals` - Get project-specific approvals
    91‚Üí- `GET /projects/{project_id}/approvals/{approval_id}` - Get approval details
    92‚Üí- `POST /projects/{project_id}/approvals/{approval_id}/steps/{step_id}/action` - Take action on approval step
    93‚Üí- `GET /my-approvals` - Get approvals for current user
    94‚Üí
    95‚Üí## Files to Modify
    96‚Üí
    97‚Üí| File | Service | What to Change |
    98‚Üí|------|---------|---------------|
    99‚Üí| `frontend/src/App.tsx` | frontend | Add new route for approval queue page |
   100‚Üí| `frontend/src/pages/ApprovalQueuePage.tsx` | frontend | Create new page component (new file) |
   101‚Üí| `frontend/src/components/ApprovalQueueList.tsx` | frontend | Create table component with filters (new file) |
   102‚Üí| `frontend/src/api/approvals.ts` | frontend | Create API client for approval endpoints (new file) |
   103‚Üí| `frontend/src/types/approval.ts` | frontend | Create TypeScript types for approval data (new file) |
   104‚Üí
   105‚Üí## Files to Reference
   106‚Üí
   107‚ÜíThese files show patterns to follow:
   108‚Üí
   109‚Üí| File | Pattern to Copy |
   110‚Üí|------|----------------|

   115‚Üí| `backend/app/api/v1/approvals.py` | Response data structure for approvals |
   116‚Üí
   117‚Üí## Patterns to Follow
   118‚Üí
   119‚Üí### Material-UI DataGrid Pattern
   120‚Üí
   121‚ÜíThe frontend uses `@mui/x-data-grid` for table displays. Expected pattern:
   122‚Üí
   123‚Üí```typescript
   124‚Üíimport { DataGrid, GridColDef } from '@mui/x-data-grid';
   125‚Üí
   126‚Üíconst columns: GridColDef[] = [
   127‚Üí  { field: 'id', headerName: 'ID', width: 90 },
   128‚Üí  { field: 'title', headerName: 'Title', width: 200 },
   129‚Üí  { field: 'status', headerName: 'Status', width: 130 },
   130‚Üí  // ... more columns
   131‚Üí];
   132‚Üí
   133‚Üí<DataGrid
   134‚Üí  rows={data}
   135‚Üí  columns={columns}
   136‚Üí  pageSize={25}
   137‚Üí  rowsPerPageOptions={[10, 25, 50, 100]}
   138‚Üí  checkboxSelection
   139‚Üí  disableSelectionOnClick
   140‚Üí  loading={isLoading}
   141‚Üí/>
   142‚Üí```
   143‚Üí
   144‚Üí**Key Points:**
   145‚Üí- Define column configuration with GridColDef type
   146‚Üí- Use pagination props for large datasets
   147‚Üí- Handle loading states with loading prop
   148‚Üí- Use checkboxSelection for future bulk actions
   149‚Üí
   150‚Üí### API Integration Pattern
   151‚Üí
   152‚ÜíFrontend uses axios for HTTP requests:
   153‚Üí
   154‚Üí```typescript
   155‚Üíimport axios from 'axios';
   156‚Üí
   157‚Üíconst API_BASE = import.meta.env.VITE_API_URL;
   158‚Üí
   159‚Üíexport const fetchApprovals = async (filters?: ApprovalFilters) => {
   160‚Üí  const response = await axios.get(`${API_BASE}/my-approvals`, {
   161‚Üí    params: filters
   162‚Üí  });
   163‚Üí  return response.data;
   164‚Üí};
   165‚Üí```
   166‚Üí
   167‚Üí**Key Points:**
   168‚Üí- Use environment variable for API base URL
   169‚Üí- Export async functions for each endpoint
   170‚Üí- Handle query parameters for filtering
   171‚Üí- Return typed response data
   172‚Üí
   173‚Üí### React Page Component Pattern
   174‚Üí
   175‚ÜíExpected structure for page components:
   176‚Üí
   177‚Üí```typescript
   178‚Üíimport React, { useState, useEffect } from 'react';
   179‚Üíimport { Container, Typography, Box } from '@mui/material';
   180‚Üí
   181‚Üíexport const ApprovalQueuePage: React.FC = () => {
   182‚Üí  const [data, setData] = useState([]);
   183‚Üí  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true);
   184‚Üí  const [error, setError] = useState<string | null>(null);
   185‚Üí
   186‚Üí  useEffect(() => {
   187‚Üí    // Fetch data on mount
   188‚Üí  }, []);
   189‚Üí
   190‚Üí  return (
   191‚Üí    <Container maxWidth="xl">
   192‚Üí      <Typography variant="h4" component="h1" gutterBottom>
   193‚Üí        Approval Queue
   194‚Üí      </Typography>
   195‚Üí      {/* Component content */}
   196‚Üí    </Container>
   197‚Üí  );
   198‚Üí};
   199‚Üí```
   200‚Üí
   201‚Üí**Key Points:**
   202‚Üí- Use functional components with TypeScript
   203‚Üí- Manage state with useState hooks
   204‚Üí- Fetch data with useEffect
   205‚Üí- Use Material-UI Container for layout
   206‚Üí
   207‚Üí## Requirements
   208‚Üí
   209‚Üí### Functional Requirements
   210‚Üí
   211‚Üí1. **Display Approval Queue Table**
   212‚Üí   - Description: Show all pending approvals in a paginated table view
   213‚Üí   - Acceptance: Table displays approval ID, title, project, requester, status, created date, and due date columns
   214‚Üí
   215‚Üí2. **Filter Approvals**
   216‚Üí   - Description: Provide filter controls above the table for status, project, and date range
   217‚Üí   - Acceptance: Filters update table data when changed, with immediate visual feedback
   218‚Üí
   219‚Üí3. **Sort Approvals**
   220‚Üí   - Description: Allow sorting by any column (ascending/descending)
   221‚Üí   - Acceptance: Clicking column headers sorts the data
   222‚Üí
   223‚Üí4. **View Approval Details**
   224‚Üí   - Description: Navigate to detailed approval view when clicking a row
   225‚Üí   - Acceptance: Clicking a row opens approval detail page
   226‚Üí
   227‚Üí5. **Take Actions**
   228‚Üí   - Description: Provide approve/reject action buttons in the action column
   229‚Üí   - Acceptance: Action buttons trigger appropriate API calls and update UI on success
   230‚Üí
   231‚Üí6. **Show Loading States**
   232‚Üí   - Description: Display loading indicators while fetching data
   233‚Üí   - Acceptance: Skeleton or spinner shown during API calls
   234‚Üí
   235‚Üí7. **Handle Empty State**
   236‚Üí   - Description: Show helpful message when no approvals match filters
   237‚Üí   - Acceptance: "No approvals found" message with illustration displayed when table is empty
   238‚Üí
   239‚Üí### Edge Cases
   240‚Üí
   241‚Üí1. **API Error Handling** - Display error message in Snackbar/Alert component when API fails, allow retry
   242‚Üí2. **Stale Data** - Implement refresh button or auto-refresh to ensure data is current
   243‚Üí3. **Permission-Based Display** - Show only approvals the current user has permission to view/act upon
   244‚Üí4. **Long Approval Titles** - Truncate long text with ellipsis and show full text on hover
   245‚Üí5. **Concurrent Actions** - Disable action buttons after click to prevent duplicate submissions
   246‚Üí
   247‚Üí## Implementation Notes
   248‚Üí
   249‚Üí### DO
   250‚Üí- Use Material-UI DataGrid (@mui/x-data-grid) for the table component
   251‚Üí- Implement TypeScript interfaces for all approval data structures
   252‚Üí- Follow existing Material-UI theming and styling patterns
   253‚Üí- Use axios for API calls with proper error handling
   254‚Üí- Add loading skeletons during data fetch
   255‚Üí- Implement proper TypeScr

    40‚Üí  const [submitting, setSubmitting] = useState(false)

    43‚Üí  useEffect(() => {

    46‚Üí
    47‚Üí  const loadData = async () => {
    48‚Üí    try {
    49‚Üí      setLoading(true)
    50‚Üí      const [approvalsData, equipmentData, materialsData] = await Promise.all([
    51‚Üí        approvalsApi.list().catch(() => []),
    52‚Üí        equipmentApi.list().catch(() => []),

    98‚Üí      default: return { icon: <PendingIcon sx={{ fontSize: 18 }} />, color: 'text.disabled', bg: 'action.hover' }
    99‚Üí    }
   100‚Üí  }
   101‚Üí

1‚Üíimport { useState, useEffect } from 'react'

    22‚Üíimport { SearchField, TextField } from '../components/ui/TextField'
    23‚Üíimport { FormModal, ConfirmModal } from '../components/ui/Modal'
    24‚Üíimport { Tabs } from '../components/ui/Tabs'
    25‚Üíimport { EmptyState } from '../components/ui/EmptyState'
    26‚Üíimport { materialsApi } from '../api/materials'
    27‚Üíimport type { Material } from '../types'
    28‚Üíimport { validateMaterialForm, hasErrors, VALIDATION, type ValidationError } from '../utils/validation'
    29‚Üíimport { useToast } from '../components/common/ToastProvider'
    30‚Üí
    31‚Üíconst materialTypes = ['Structural', 'Finishing', 'Safety', 'MEP', 'Insulation']
    32‚Üíconst unitOptions = ['ton', 'm3', 'm2', 'm', 'kg', 'unit', 'box', 'pallet', 'roll']
    33‚Üí
    34‚Üíexport default function MaterialsPage() {
    35‚Üí  const { projectId } = useParams()
    36‚Üí  const { showError, showSuccess } = useToast()
    37‚Üí  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true)
    38‚Üí  const [materials, setMaterials] = useState<Material[]>([])
    39‚Üí  const [search, setSearch] = useState('')
    40‚Üí  const [dialogOpen, setDialogOpen] = useState(false)
    41‚Üí  const [editingMaterial, setEditingMaterial] = useState<Material | null>(null)
    42‚Üí  const [deleteDialogOpen, setDeleteDialogOpen] = useState(false)
    43‚Üí  const [materialToDelete, setMaterialToDelete] = useState<Material | null>(null)
    44‚Üí  const [saving, setSaving] = useState(false)
    45‚Üí  const [errors, setErrors] = useState<ValidationError>({})
    46‚Üí  const [activeTab, setActiveTab] = useState('all')
    47‚Üí  const [formData, setFormData] = useState({
    48‚Üí    name: '',
    49‚Üí    materialType: '',
    50‚Üí    manufacturer: '',
    51‚Üí    modelNumber: '',
    52‚Üí    quantity: '',
    53‚Üí    unit: '',
    54‚Üí    expectedDelivery: '',
    55‚Üí    storageLocation: '',
    56‚Üí    notes: ''
    57‚Üí  })
    58‚Üí
    59‚Üí  useEffect(() => {
    60‚Üí    loadMaterials()
    61‚Üí  }, [projectId])
    62‚Üí
    63‚Üí  const loadMaterials = async () => {
    64‚Üí    try {
    65‚Üí      setLoading(true)
    66‚Üí      const data = await materialsApi.list(projectId)
    67‚Üí      setMaterials(data)
    68‚Üí    } catch {
    69‚Üí      showError('Failed to load materials. Please try again.')
    70‚Üí    } finally {
    71‚Üí      setLoading(false)
    72‚Üí    }
    73‚Üí  }
    74‚Üí
    75‚Üí  const resetForm = () => {
    76‚Üí    setFormData({ name: '', materialType: '', manufacturer: '', modelNumber: '', quantity: '', unit: '', expectedDelivery: '', storageLocation: '', notes: '' })
    77‚Üí    setErrors({})

    97‚Üí      modelNumber: material.modelNumber || '',
    98‚Üí      quantity: material.quantity?.toString() || '',
    99‚Üí      unit: material.unit || '',
   100‚Üí      expectedDelivery: material.expectedDelivery || '',
   101‚Üí      storageLocation: material.storageLocation || '',
   102‚Üí      notes: material.notes || ''
   103‚Üí    })
   104‚Üí    setErrors({})
   105‚Üí    setDialogOpen(true)
   106‚Üí  }
   107‚Üí
   108‚Üí  const handleSaveMaterial = async () => {
   109‚Üí    if (!projectId) return
   110‚Üí    const validationErrors = validateMaterialForm({
   111‚Üí      name: formData.name,
   112‚Üí      notes: formData.notes,
   113‚Üí      quantity: formData.quantity ? parseFloat(formData.quantity) : undefined
   114‚Üí    })
   115‚Üí    setErrors(validationErrors)
   116‚Üí    if (hasErrors(validationErrors)) return
   117‚Üí
   118‚Üí    setSaving(true)
   119‚Üí    try {
   120‚Üí      const payload = {
   121‚Üí        name: formData.name,
   122‚Üí        material_type: formData.materialType || undefined,
   123‚Üí        manufacturer: formData.manufacturer || undefined,
   124‚Üí        model_number: formData.modelNumber || undefined,
   125‚Üí        quantity: formData.quantity ? parseFloat(formData.quantity) : undefined,
   126‚Üí        unit: formData.unit || undefined,
   127‚Üí        expected_delivery: formData.expectedDelivery || undefined,
   128‚Üí        storage_location: formData.storageLocation || undefined,
   129‚Üí        notes: formData.notes || undefined
   130‚Üí      }
   131‚Üí
   132‚Üí      if (editingMaterial) {
   133‚Üí        await materialsApi.update(projectId, editingMaterial.id, payload)
   134‚Üí        showSuccess('Material updated successfully!')
   135‚Üí      } else {
   136‚Üí        await materialsApi.create(projectId, payload)
   137‚Üí        showSuccess('Material created successfully!')
   138‚Üí      }
   139‚Üí      handleCloseDialog()
   140‚Üí      loadMaterials()
   141‚Üí    } catch {

   145‚Üí    }
   146‚Üí  }
   147‚Üí
   148‚Üí  const handleDeleteClick = (material: Material, e?: React.MouseEvent) => {

   150‚Üí    setMaterialToDelete(material)
   151‚Üí    setDeleteDialogOpen(true)

   153‚Üí
   154‚Üí  const handleConfirmDelete = async () => {
   155‚Üí    if (!projectId || !materialToDelete) return

   166‚Üí
   167‚Üí  const filteredMaterials = materials.filter(m => {
   168‚Üí    const matchesSearch = m.name.toLowerCase().includes(search.toLowerCase()) ||
   169‚Üí      m.materialType?.toLowerCase().includes(search.toLowerCase())

   173‚Üí
   174‚Üí  const pendingMaterials = materials.filter(m => m.status === 'submitted' || m.status === 'under_review').length
   175‚Üí  const approvedMaterials = materials.filter(m => m.status === 'approved').length
   176‚Üí  const totalQuantity = materials.reduce((sum, m) => sum + (m.quantity || 0), 0)
   177‚Üí

     2‚Üíimport Layout from './components/layout/Layout'
     3‚Üíimport LoginPage from './pages/LoginPage'
     4‚Üíimport DashboardPage from './pages/DashboardPage'

    16‚Üí
    17‚Üífunction ProtectedRoute() {
    18‚Üí  const token = localStorage.getItem('authToken')
    19‚Üí  if (!token) {
    20‚Üí    return <Navigate to="/login" replace />
    21‚Üí  }
    22‚Üí  return <Outlet />
    23‚Üí}
    24‚Üí

    26‚Üí  return (
    27‚Üí    <Routes>

    29‚Üí

    41‚Üí              <Route path="areas" element={<AreasPage />} />

    45‚Üí            </Route>
    46‚Üí

    48‚Üí            <Route path="/audit" element={<AuditLogPage />} />
    49‚Üí          </Route>
    50‚Üí        </Route>
    51‚Üí
    52‚Üí        <Route path="*" element={<Navigate to="/login" replace />} />
    53‚Üí      </Routes>

   ```typescript

   ```

1‚Üíimport { apiClient } from './client'
     2‚Üíimport type { ApprovalRequest } from '../types'
     3‚Üí
     4‚Üíinterface ApprovalAction {
     5‚Üí  action: 'approve' | 'reject' | 'revision'
     6‚Üí  comments?: string
     7‚Üí}
     8‚Üí
     9‚Üíexport const approvalsApi = {
    10‚Üí  list: async (projectId?: string): Promise<ApprovalRequest[]> => {
    11‚Üí    const url = projectId ? `/projects/${projectId}/approvals` : '/approvals'
    12‚Üí    const response = await apiClient.get(url)
    13‚Üí    return response.data
    14‚Üí  },
    15‚Üí
    16‚Üí  approve: async (id: string, comments?: string): Promise<ApprovalRequest> => {
    17‚Üí    const response = await apiClient.post(`/approvals/${id}/approve`, { comments })
    18‚Üí    return response.data
    19‚Üí  },
    20‚Üí
    21‚Üí  reject: async (id: string, comments: string): Promise<ApprovalRequest> => {
    22‚Üí    const response = await apiClient.post(`/approvals/${id}/reject`, { comments })
    23‚Üí    return response.data
    24‚Üí  },
    25‚Üí
    26‚Üí  get: async (projectId: string, id: string): Promise<ApprovalRequest> => {
    27‚Üí    const response = await apiClient.get(`/projects/${projectId}/approvals/${id}`)
    28‚Üí    return response.data
    29‚Üí  },
    30‚Üí
    31‚Üí  processStep: async (projectId: string, approvalId: string, stepId: string, data: ApprovalAction) => {
    32‚Üí    const response = await apiClient.post(
    33‚Üí      `/projects/${projectId}/approvals/${approvalId}/steps/${stepId}/action`,
    34‚Üí      data
    35‚Üí    )
    36‚Üí    return response.data
    37‚Üí  },
    38‚Üí

1‚Üíimport { apiClient } from './client'
     2‚Üíimport type { ApprovalRequest } from '../types'

     4‚Üíinterface ApprovalAction {

     9‚Üíexport const approvalsApi = {
    10‚Üí  list: async (projectId?: string): Promise<ApprovalRequest[]> => {
    11‚Üí    const url = projectId ? `/projects/${projectId}/approvals` : '/approvals'
    12‚Üí    const response = await apiClient.get(url)
    13‚Üí    return response.data

    15‚Üí
    16‚Üí  approve: async (id: string, comments?: string): Promise<ApprovalRequest> => {
    17‚Üí    const response = await apiClient.post(`/approvals/${id}/approve`, { comments })
    18‚Üí    return response.data
    19‚Üí  },
    20‚Üí
    21‚Üí  reject: async (id: string, comments: string): Promise<ApprovalRequest> => {
    22‚Üí    const response = await apiClient.post(`/approvals/${id}/reject`, { comments })
    23‚Üí    return response.data
    24‚Üí  },
    25‚Üí
    26‚Üí  get: async (projectId: string, id: string): Promise<ApprovalRequest> => {
    27‚Üí    const response = await apiClient.get(`/projects/${projectId}/approvals/${id}`)
    28‚Üí    return response.data
    29‚Üí  },
    30‚Üí
    31‚Üí  processStep: async (projectId: string, approvalId: string, stepId: string, data: ApprovalAction) => {
    32‚Üí    const response = await apiClient.post(
    33‚Üí      `/projects/${projectId}/approvals/${approvalId}/steps/${stepId}/action`,
    34‚Üí      data
    35‚Üí    )
    36‚Üí    return response.data
    37‚Üí  },
    38‚Üí
    39‚Üí  myPending: async (): Promise<ApprovalRequest[]> => {
    40‚Üí    const response = await apiClient.get('/my-approvals')
    41‚Üí    return response.data
    42‚Üí  },
    43‚Üí}

1‚Üíimport { useState, useEffect } from 'react'
     2‚Üíimport Box from '@mui/material/Box'
     3‚Üíimport Typography from '@mui/material/Typography'
     4‚Üíimport Chip from '@mui/material/Chip'
     5‚Üíimport Skeleton from '@mui/material/Skeleton'
     6‚Üíimport BuildIcon from '@mui/icons-material/Build'
     7‚Üíimport InventoryIcon from '@mui/icons-material/Inventory'
     8‚Üíimport CheckCircleIcon from '@mui/icons-material/CheckCircle'
     9‚Üíimport CancelIcon from '@mui/icons-material/Cancel'
    10‚Üíimport PendingIcon from '@mui/icons-material/Pending'
    11‚Üíimport FilterListIcon from '@mui/icons-material/FilterList'
    12‚Üíimport ThumbUpIcon from '@mui/icons-material/ThumbUp'
    13‚Üíimport ThumbDownIcon from '@mui/icons-material/ThumbDown'
    14‚Üíimport { Card, KPICard } from '../components/ui/Card'
    15‚Üíimport { Button } from '../components/ui/Button'
    16‚Üíimport { StatusBadge } from '../components/ui/StatusBadge'
    17‚Üíimport { PageHeader } from '../components/ui/Breadcrumbs'
    18‚Üíimport { Tabs } from '../components/ui/Tabs'
    19‚Üíimport { EmptyState } from '../components/ui/EmptyState'
    20‚Üíimport { FormModal } from '../components/ui/Modal'
    21‚Üíimport { TextField, SearchField } from '../components/ui/TextField'
    22‚Üíimport { ProgressBar } from '../components/ui/ProgressBar'
    23‚Üíimport { approvalsApi } from '../api/approvals'
    24‚Üíimport { equipmentApi } from '../api/equipment'
    25‚Üíimport { materialsApi } from '../api/materials'
    26‚Üíimport { useToast } from '../components/common/ToastProvider'
    27‚Üíimport type { ApprovalRequest, ApprovalStep, Equipment, Material } from '../types'
    28‚Üí
    29‚Üíexport default function ApprovalsPage() {
    30‚Üí  const { showError, showSuccess } = useToast()
    31‚Üí  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true)
    32‚Üí  const [approvals, setApprovals] = useState<ApprovalRequest[]>([])
    33‚Üí  const [equipment, setEquipment] = useState<Equipment[]>([])
    34‚Üí  const [materials, setMaterials] = useState<Material[]>([])
    35‚Üí  const [tabValue, setTabValue] = useState('pending')
    36‚Üí  const [selectedApproval, setSelectedApproval] = useState<ApprovalRequest | null>(null)
    37‚Üí  const [dialogOpen, setDialogOpen] = useState(false)
    38‚Üí  const [actionType, setActionType] = useState<'approve' | 'reject' | null>(null)
    39‚Üí  const [comment, setComment] = useState('')
    40‚Üí  const [submitting, setSubmitting] = useState(false)
    41‚Üí  const [searchQuery, setSearchQuery] = useState('')
    42‚Üí
    43‚Üí  useEffect(() => {
    44‚Üí    loadData()
    45‚Üí  }, [])
    46‚Üí
    47‚Üí  const loadData = async () => {
    48‚Üí    try {
    49‚Üí      setLoading(true)
    50‚Üí      const [approvalsData, equipmentData, materialsData] = await Promise.all([
    51‚Üí        approvalsApi.list().catch(() => []),
    52‚Üí        equipmentApi.list().catch(() => []),
    53‚Üí        materialsApi.list().catch(() => [])
    54‚Üí      ])
    55‚Üí      setApprovals(approvalsData)
    56‚Üí      setEquipment(equipmentData)
    57‚Üí      setMaterials(materialsData)
    58‚Üí    } catch {
    59‚Üí      showError('Failed to load approval data. Please try again.')
    60‚Üí    } finally {
    61‚Üí      setLoading(false)
    62‚Üí    }
    63‚Üí  }
    64‚Üí
    65‚Üí  const pendingApprovals = approvals.filter(a => a.currentStatus !== 'approved' && a.currentStatus !== 'rejected')
    66‚Üí  const approvedApprovals = approvals.filter(a => a.currentStatus === 'approved')
    67‚Üí  const rejectedApprovals = approvals.filter(a => a.currentStatus === 'rejected')
    68‚Üí
    69‚Üí  const getDisplayedApprovals = () => {
    70‚Üí    let filtered = approvals
    71‚Üí    if (tabValue === 'pending') filtered = pendingApprovals
    72‚Üí    else if (tabValue === 'approved') filtered = approvedApprovals
    73‚Üí    else if (tabValue === 'rejected') filtered = rejectedApprovals
    74‚Üí
    75‚Üí    if (searchQuery) {
    76‚Üí      filtered = filtered.filter(a => {
    77‚Üí        const entity = getEntityDetails(a)
    78‚Üí        return entity?.name.toLowerCase().includes(searchQuery.toLowerCase())
    79‚Üí      })
    80‚Üí    }
    81‚Üí    return filtered
    82‚Üí  }
    83‚Üí
    84‚Üí  const displayedApprovals = getDisplayedApprovals()
    85‚Üí
    86‚Üí  const getEntityDetails = (approval: ApprovalRequest) => {
    87‚Üí    if (approval.entityType === 'equipment') {
    88‚Üí      return equipment.find(e => e.id === approval.entityId)
    89‚Üí    }
    90‚Üí    return materials.find(m => m.id === approval.entityId)
    91‚Üí  }
    92‚Üí
    93‚Üí  const getStepStatus = (step: ApprovalStep) => {

   118‚Üí          {secondaryAction && (

    26‚Üíexport function ApprovalQueueList({ onViewDetails }: ApprovalQueueListProps) {
    27‚Üí  const { showError, showSuccess } = useToast()

    29‚Üí  const [error, setError] = useState(false)
    30‚Üí  const [approvals, setApprovals] = useState<ApprovalRow[]>([])
    31‚Üí  const [tabValue, setTabValue] = useState('pending')
    32‚Üí  const [searchQuery, setSearchQuery] = useState('')
    33‚Üí  const [selectedApproval, setSelectedApproval] = useState<ApprovalRow | null>(null)
    34‚Üí  const [dialogOpen, setDialogOpen] = useState(false)
    35‚Üí  const [actionType, setActionType] = useState<'approve' | 'reject' | null>(null)
    36‚Üí  const [comment, setComment] = useState('')
    37‚Üí  const [submitting, setSubmitting] = useState(false)
    38‚Üí
    39‚Üí  useEffect(() => {
    40‚Üí    loadData()
    41‚Üí  }, [])
    42‚Üí
    43‚Üí  const loadData = async () => {
    44‚Üí    try {
    45‚Üí      setLoading(true)
    46‚Üí      setError(false)
    47‚Üí      const data = await approvalsApi.myPending()
    48‚Üí
    49‚Üí      // Transform data to include entity names
    50‚Üí      const transformedData: ApprovalRow[] = data.map((approval) => ({
    51‚Üí        ...approval,
    52‚Üí        entityName: `${approval.entityType.charAt(0).toUpperCase() + approval.entityType.slice(1)} ${approval.entityId}`,
    53‚Üí        requesterName: approval.createdBy?.fullName || approval.createdBy?.email || 'Unknown',
    54‚Üí        projectName: approval.projectId,
    55‚Üí      }))
    56‚Üí
    57‚Üí      setApprovals(transformedData)
    58‚Üí    } catch {
    59‚Üí      setError(true)
    60‚Üí      showError('Failed to load approvals. Please try again.')
    61‚Üí    } finally {
    62‚Üí      setLoading(false)
    63‚Üí    }
    64‚Üí  }
    65‚Üí
    66‚Üí  const pendingApprovals = approvals.filter(
    67‚Üí    (a) => a.currentStatus !== 'approved' && a.currentStatus !== 'rejected'
    68‚Üí  )
    69‚Üí  const approvedApprovals = approvals.filter((a) => a.currentStatus === 'approved')
    70‚Üí  const rejectedApprovals = approvals.filter((a) => a.currentStatus === 'rejected')
    71‚Üí
    72‚Üí  const getDisplayedApprovals = () => {
    73‚Üí    let filtered = approvals

    77‚Üí
    78‚Üí    if (searchQuery) {
    79‚Üí      filtered = filtered.filter(
    80‚Üí        (a) =>
    81‚Üí          a.entityName.toLowerCase().includes(searchQuery.toLowerCase()) ||
    82‚Üí          a.requesterName.toLowerCase().includes(searchQuery.toLowerCase())
    83‚Üí      )

    87‚Üí

    90‚Üí  const handleAction = (approval: ApprovalRow, action: 'approve' | 'reject') => {

    94‚Üí  }
    95‚Üí
    96‚Üí  const handleSubmitAction = async () => {

   149‚Üí          <Box sx={{ fontSize: '0.75rem', color: 'text.secondary' }}>
   150‚Üí            {row.entityType.charAt(0).toUpperCase() + row.entityType.slice(1)}
   151‚Üí          </Box>
   152‚Üí        </Box>

entries.content:
## ‚úÖ Subtask Complete: Loading States, Error Handling, and Empty State

I've successfully implemented loading states, error handling, and empty state functionality for the approval queue list view. Here's what was added:

### Changes Made

**1. ApprovalQueueList.tsx** - Enhanced with comprehensive state management:

- **Error State Management**
  - Added `error` state to track API failures
  - Error state displays EmptyState component with retry button
  - Error resets when retrying data load

- **Enhanced Empty States**
  - Replaced basic empty message with EmptyState component
  - Context-aware messages based on:
    - Tab selection (Pending, Approved, Rejected, All)
    - Search query presence
  - Displays appropriate icon and descriptive text

- **Loading State**
  - Maintained existing loading skeleton through DataTable component
  - Shows skeleton table rows during data fetch

### Key Features

‚úÖ **Error Handling**
- Visual error state with retry functionality
- Toast notifications for user feedback
- Graceful fallback on API failures

‚úÖ **Empty States**
- "No pending approvals" - All requests have been processed
- "No approvals found" - Try adjusting your search criteria
- Context-specific messages for each tab

‚úÖ **Loading States**
- Skeleton loader during initial data fetch
- Table skeleton shows 5 rows with shimmer effect
- Maintained through DataTable's built-in loading prop

### Code Quality
- ‚úÖ Follows patterns from ApprovalsPage.tsx
- ‚úÖ No console.log debugging statements
- ‚úÖ Proper error boundaries and try/catch blocks
- ‚úÖ TypeScript type safety maintained
- ‚úÖ Clean, maintainable code structure

### Commit
```
auto-claude: subtask-2-3 - Add loading states, error handling, and empty state
```

The implementation is complete and ready for verification at http://localhost:3000/approval-queue when the dev server is running.
I'll help you perform the end-to-end verification of the approval queue functionality. Let me start by checking my current directory and reading the relevant files.

entries.detail:
1‚Üí# Specification: Build Approval Queue List View
     2‚Üí
     3‚Üí## Overview
     4‚Üí
     5‚ÜíThis feature adds a new Approval Queue List View component to the frontend that displays pending approvals in a filterable, sortable table format. Users will be able to view all approvals requiring their action, filter by various criteria, and take action directly from the list view. The component will consume the existing `/my-approvals` and `/approvals` API endpoints to fetch approval data.
     6‚Üí
     7‚Üí## Workflow Type
     8‚Üí
     9‚Üí**Type**: feature
    10‚Üí
    11‚Üí**Rationale**: This is a new user-facing component that adds functionality to display and manage approval queues. It introduces a new view with table display, filtering capabilities, and action buttons, making it a standard feature implementation workflow.
    12‚Üí
    13‚Üí## Task Scope
    14‚Üí
    15‚Üí### Services Involved
    16‚Üí- **frontend** (primary) - Create new approval queue list view component with table, filters, and actions
    17‚Üí- **backend** (integration) - Consume existing approval endpoints for data retrieval and action execution
    18‚Üí
    19‚Üí### This Task Will:
    20‚Üí- [ ] Create a new ApprovalQueueList component using Material-UI DataGrid
    21‚Üí- [ ] Implement filter controls for status, project, date range, and approval type
    22‚Üí- [ ] Add action buttons for approve/reject/view details
    23‚Üí- [ ] Integrate with existing `/my-approvals` and `/approvals` API endpoints
    24‚Üí- [ ] Add routing configuration for the new approval queue page
    25‚Üí- [ ] Implement loading and error states
    26‚Üí- [ ] Add pagination support for large datasets
    27‚Üí
    28‚Üí### Out of Scope:
    29‚Üí- Backend API modifications (existing approval endpoints will be used as-is)
    30‚Üí- Approval workflow logic changes
    31‚Üí- Email notifications for approval actions
    32‚Üí- Bulk approval operations (can be added in future iteration)
    33‚Üí- Mobile-optimized view (desktop-first approach)
    34‚Üí
    35‚Üí## Service Context
    36‚Üí
    37‚Üí### Frontend
    38‚Üí
    39‚Üí**Tech Stack:**
    40‚Üí- Language: TypeScript
    41‚Üí- Framework: React
    42‚Üí- UI Library: Material-UI (@mui/material, @mui/x-data-grid)
    43‚Üí- Styling: Emotion
    44‚Üí- Build Tool: Vite
    45‚Üí- HTTP Client: axios
    46‚Üí- Routing: react-router-dom
    47‚Üí
    48‚Üí**Key directories:**
    49‚Üí- `src/` - Source code directory
    50‚Üí- `src/components/` - Reusable components (expected location)
    51‚Üí- `src/pages/` - Page-level components (expected location)
    52‚Üí- `src/api/` - API integration layer (expected location)
    53‚Üí
    54‚Üí**Entry Point:** `src/App.tsx`
    55‚Üí
    56‚Üí**How to Run:**
    57‚Üí```bash
    58‚Üícd frontend
    59‚Üínpm run dev
    60‚Üí```
    61‚Üí
    62‚Üí**Port:** 3000
    63‚Üí
    64‚Üí**Environment Variables:**
    65‚Üí- `VITE_API_URL`: http://localhost:8000/api/v1
    66‚Üí
    67‚Üí### Backend
    68‚Üí
    69‚Üí**Tech Stack:**
    70‚Üí- Language: Python
    71‚Üí- Framework: FastAPI
    72‚Üí- ORM: SQLAlchemy
    73‚Üí- Database: PostgreSQL
    74‚Üí
    75‚Üí**Key directories:**
    76‚Üí- `app/` - Application code
    77‚Üí- `app/api/v1/` - API route handlers
    78‚Üí- `app/models/` - Database models
    79‚Üí
    80‚Üí**How to Run:**
    81‚Üí```bash
    82‚Üícd backend
    83‚Üíuvicorn app.main:app --reload --port 8000
    84‚Üí```
    85‚Üí
    86‚Üí**Port:** 8000
    87‚Üí
    88‚Üí**Relevant API Endpoints:**
    89‚Üí- `GET /approvals` - Get all approvals
    90‚Üí- `GET /projects/{project_id}/approvals` - Get project-specific approvals
    91‚Üí- `GET /projects/{project_id}/approvals/{approval_id}` - Get approval details
    92‚Üí- `POST /projects/{project_id}/approvals/{approval_id}/steps/{step_id}/action` - Take action on approval step
    93‚Üí- `GET /my-approvals` - Get approvals for current user
    94‚Üí
    95‚Üí## Files to Modify
    96‚Üí
    97‚Üí| File | Service | What to Change |
    98‚Üí|------|---------|---------------|
    99‚Üí| `frontend/src/App.tsx` | frontend | Add new route for approval queue page |
   100‚Üí| `frontend/src/pages/ApprovalQueuePage.tsx` | frontend | Create new page component (new file) |
   101‚Üí| `frontend/src/components/ApprovalQueueList.tsx` | frontend | Create table component with filters (new file) |
   102‚Üí| `frontend/src/api/approvals.ts` | frontend | Create API client for approval endpoints (new file) |
   103‚Üí| `frontend/src/types/approval.ts` | frontend | Create TypeScript types for approval data (new file) |
   104‚Üí
   105‚Üí## Files to Reference
   106‚Üí
   107‚ÜíThese files show patterns to follow:
   108‚Üí
   109‚Üí| File | Pattern to Copy |
   110‚Üí|------|----------------|
   111‚Üí| Files to be discovered | Material-UI DataGrid usage pattern |
   112‚Üí| Files to be discovered | API integration with axios pattern |
   113‚Üí| Files to be discovered | Filter component implementation |
   114‚Üí| Files to be discovered | Page routing configuration |
   115‚Üí| `backend/app/api/v1/approvals.py` | Response data structure for approvals |
   116‚Üí
   117‚Üí## Patterns to Follow
   118‚Üí
   119‚Üí### Material-UI DataGrid Pattern
   120‚Üí
   121‚ÜíThe frontend uses `@mui/x-data-grid` for table displays. Expected pattern:
   122‚Üí
   123‚Üí```typescript
   124‚Üíimport { DataGrid, GridColDef } from '@mui/x-data-grid';
   125‚Üí
   126‚Üíconst columns: GridColDef[] = [
   127‚Üí  { field: 'id', headerName: 'ID', width: 90 },
   128‚Üí  { field: 'title', headerName: 'Title', width: 200 },
   129‚Üí  { field: 'status', headerName: 'Status', width: 130 },
   130‚Üí  // ... more columns
   131‚Üí];
   132‚Üí
   133‚Üí<DataGrid
   134‚Üí  rows={data}
   135‚Üí  columns={columns}
   136‚Üí  pageSize={25}
   137‚Üí  rowsPerPageOptions={[10, 25, 50, 100]}
   138‚Üí  checkboxSelection
   139‚Üí  disableSelectionOnClick
   140‚Üí  loading={isLoading}
   141‚Üí/>
   142‚Üí```
   143‚Üí
   144‚Üí**Key Points:**
   145‚Üí- Define column configuration with GridColDef type
   146‚Üí- Use pagination props for large datasets
   147‚Üí- Handle loading states with loading prop
   148‚Üí- Use checkboxSelection for future bulk actions
   149‚Üí
   150‚Üí### API Integration Pattern
   151‚Üí
   152‚ÜíFrontend uses axios for HTTP requests:
   153‚Üí
   154‚Üí```typescript
   155‚Üíimport axios from 'axios';
   156‚Üí
   157‚Üíconst API_BASE = import.meta.env.VITE_API_URL;
   158‚Üí
   159‚Üíexport const fetchApprovals = async (filters?: ApprovalFilters) => {
   160‚Üí  const response = await axios.get(`${API_BASE}/my-approvals`, {
   161‚Üí    params: filters
   162‚Üí  });
   163‚Üí  return response.data;
   164‚Üí};
   165‚Üí```
   166‚Üí
   167‚Üí**Key Points:**
   168‚Üí- Use environment variable for API base URL
   169‚Üí- Export async functions for each endpoint
   170‚Üí- Handle query parameters for filtering
   171‚Üí- Return typed response data
   172‚Üí
   173‚Üí### React Page Component Pattern
   174‚Üí
   175‚ÜíExpected structure for page components:
   176‚Üí
   177‚Üí```typescript
   178‚Üíimport React, { useState, useEffect } from 'react';
   179‚Üíimport { Container, Typography, Box } from '@mui/material';
   180‚Üí
   181‚Üíexport const ApprovalQueuePage: React.FC = () => {
   182‚Üí  const [data, setData] = useState([]);
   183‚Üí  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true);
   184‚Üí  const [error, setError] = useState<string | null>(null);
   185‚Üí
   186‚Üí  useEffect(() => {
   187‚Üí    // Fetch data on mount
   188‚Üí  }, []);
   189‚Üí
   190‚Üí  return (
   191‚Üí    <Container maxWidth="xl">
   192‚Üí      <Typography variant="h4" component="h1" gutterBottom>
   193‚Üí        Approval Queue
   194‚Üí      </Typography>
   195‚Üí      {/* Component content */}
   196‚Üí    </Container>
   197‚Üí  );
   198‚Üí};
   199‚Üí```
   200‚Üí
   201‚Üí**Key Points:**
   202‚Üí- Use functional components with TypeScript
   203‚Üí- Manage state with useState hooks
   204‚Üí- Fetch data with useEffect
   205‚Üí- Use Material-UI Container for layout
   206‚Üí
   207‚Üí## Requirements
   208‚Üí
   209‚Üí### Functional Requirements
   210‚Üí
   211‚Üí1. **Display Approval Queue Table**
   212‚Üí   - Description: Show all pending approvals in a paginated table view
   213‚Üí   - Acceptance: Table displays approval ID, title, project, requester, status, created date, and due date columns
   214‚Üí
   215‚Üí2. **Filter Approvals**
   216‚Üí   - Description: Provide filter controls above the table for status, project, and date range
   217‚Üí   - Acceptance: Filters update table data when changed, with immediate visual feedback
   218‚Üí
   219‚Üí3. **Sort Approvals**
   220‚Üí   - Description: Allow sorting by any column (ascending/descending)
   221‚Üí   - Acceptance: Clicking column headers sorts the data
   222‚Üí
   223‚Üí4. **View Approval Details**
   224‚Üí   - Description: Navigate to detailed approval view when clicking a row
   225‚Üí   - Acceptance: Clicking a row opens approval detail page
   226‚Üí
   227‚Üí5. **Take Actions**
   228‚Üí   - Description: Provide approve/reject action buttons in the action column
   229‚Üí   - Acceptance: Action buttons trigger appropriate API calls and update UI on success
   230‚Üí
   231‚Üí6. **Show Loading States**
   232‚Üí   - Description: Display loading indicators while fetching data
   233‚Üí   - Acceptance: Skeleton or spinner shown during API calls
   234‚Üí
   235‚Üí7. **Handle Empty State**
   236‚Üí   - Description: Show helpful message when no approvals match filters
   237‚Üí   - Acceptance: "No approvals found" message with illustration displayed when table is empty
   238‚Üí
   239‚Üí### Edge Cases
   240‚Üí
   241‚Üí1. **API Error Handling** - Display error message in Snackbar/Alert component when API fails, allow retry
   242‚Üí2. **Stale Data** - Implement refresh button or auto-refresh to ensure data is current
   243‚Üí3. **Permission-Based Display** - Show only approvals the current user has permission to view/act upon
   244‚Üí4. **Long Approval Titles** - Truncate long text with ellipsis and show full text on hover
   245‚Üí5. **Concurrent Actions** - Disable action buttons after click to prevent duplicate submissions
   246‚Üí
   247‚Üí## Implementation Notes
   248‚Üí
   249‚Üí### DO
   250‚Üí- Use Material-UI DataGrid (@mui/x-data-grid) for the table component
   251‚Üí- Implement TypeScript interfaces for all approval data structures
   252‚Üí- Follow existing Material-UI theming and styling patterns
   253‚Üí- Use axios for API calls with proper error handling
   254‚Üí- Add loading skeletons during data fetch
   255‚Üí- Implement proper TypeScr
